clinical_study.official_title: Birth Environment of the Future - a Randomised Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to explore the impact of the birth environment on women's birth experience and relevant birth outcomes in the experimental Labour room compared to a standard Labour room.

detailed_description.textblock:
In the last decade, there has been an increased interest in exploring the impact of the birth environment on midwifery practice and the women's birth experiences. Results from these studies show that a home-like birth environment has positive effects on both midwifery practice and the birth experience. The hormone oxytocin that causes contractions during labour may play an important role in this context. The hormone is released when being in a safe, secure and confident environment. Therefore, it is a reasonable assumption that the birth environment also has an impact on birth outcomes.
To investigate this assumption one traditional labour room was transformed to an experimental labour room. The design of the room is inspired by knowledge from evidence-based healthcare design, which describes bringing nature into the room. Furthermore, it is possible for the parents to design their own birth setting by choosing atmosphere through sound, light and nature scenes.

primary_outcome.measure: No. of women receiving oxytocin stimulation during Labour
primary_outcome.time_frame: From allocation at delivery ward (date, hour and minute) to delivery (date, hour, minute). Duration is recorded time in hours and minutes
primary_outcome.description: No of women augmented with oxytocin drip. The intervention is registered in the electronic patient journal. The duration in time (date,hours,minutes) of oxytocin treatment is registered in the electronic journal log

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From allocation at delivery ward (date, hour and minute) to delivery (date, hour, minute). Duration is recorded time in hours and minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Minutes of stay in labour room until delivery is registered in separate data sheet with time of arrival and time of delivery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From allocation at delivery ward (date, hour and minute) to delivery (date, hour, minute). Duration is recorded time in hours and minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Interventions with epidural and pudendal analgesia are registered in the electronic patient journal

other_outcome.measure: Evaluation of woman-centred care during labour and childbirth
other_outcome.time_frame: Six weeks after delivery a questionaire is e-mailed to the women
other_outcome.description: Woman-centred care during labour and childbirth questionnaire

other_outcome.measure: Paternal evaluation of the labour room environment
other_outcome.time_frame: Two weeks after delivery a questionnaire is e-mailed to the father

arm_group.description: Supportive care of labour room designed with special attention on sound and light effects, covering medical devices and insulation from outside noise

arm_group.description: The woman gives labour in a standard labour room

intervention.intervention_name: Supportive care in a specially designed labour room
intervention.description: Light and sound effects, homelike design in furniture and wall paper, sound insulation of walls, covering medical devices in walls, apparatus, and cupboards
intervention.arm_group_label: Labour in a standard labour room

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- primiparas with a singleton pregnancy
- Gestational age 37-42
- speaks and understands Danish
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inducted delivery
